Like this \nBABBLE-ON-HEART ATTACK ANNIVERSARY SHOW: https://t.co/JtWsKSBbdA https://t.co/OGXWUNErNE'

b'To be fair, comics fans had the letter columns - so we could always speak truth to the power behind the books we love. But when I was a reader, it never once occurred to me to complain to them; if anything, I dreamed of being like Brodie with Stan and asking my geeky questions. https://t.co/hCVCHdA6IB'

b'Twitter likes bad news more than good news. I did a whole-ass podcast where I talked about what an asshole I was to  MAGNOLIA and PTA back in \xe2\x80\x9899, and it got no coverage at all. But my unoriginal @SpiderManMovie take is somehow news...\nFILM SCHOOL FRIDAYS: https://t.co/ZKkRReODvr https://t.co/NMZ4JmGPyx'

b'Why would anyone feel threatened by my positive opinion of a movie they didn\xe2\x80\x99t like? It doesn\xe2\x80\x99t negate (or even reference) their verdict of the same art. And yet? \xe2\x80\x9cBum\xe2\x80\x9d & \xe2\x80\x9cDouche\xe2\x80\x9d.\nBum & Douche, by the way, was the original name for BABBLE-ON! See us 2/26: https://t.co/JtWsKSBbdA https://t.co/j1qWpNXeXu'

b'Always happens. So I guess I should be flattered my dopey opinions have any weight. But I never take away anyone\xe2\x80\x99s shine to elevate the things I love, so the ire and outrage always leaves me baffled.\nNot to be confused with BABBLE, at @FlappersComedy 2/26: https://t.co/JtWsKSSMCa https://t.co/CW8FMdtsXc'

b'I might understand it if I was always shitting on people or movies, but I only talk about stuff I *like*. But people still attack my fat ass. I guess I\xe2\x80\x99ve gotta be even more positive...\nAnd I\xe2\x80\x99m positive folks will have a great time at BABBLE on 2/26! Tix: https://t.co/JtWsKSBbdA https://t.co/CxYNUPPQmh'

b'@Trunembrak @JayMewes I don\xe2\x80\x99t think this is about insecurity at all. I re-read the Tweet above and it merely asked for thoughts from strangers about a conversation I had elsewhere that I found interesting. Isn\xe2\x80\x99t that what people do on Twitter?'
b'@chrsdunlap @JayMewes Where was he ever arguing?'

b'@JamJeff19 @amnesia0287 @BenderBRodrig15 @JayMewes I was there in the 90\xe2\x80\x99s and  this isn\xe2\x80\x99t true at all. I never went into a bank to get a single credit card. Neither did my parents. Back then, you mailed in an application and received the credit card in the post. (Sometimes they even sent you a card if you didn\xe2\x80\x99t apply for one.)'

10 more days until goal: 37 in a row!
I bought some corrective footwear to fight the Plantar\xe2\x80\x99s Fasciitis, so I feel like a l\xe2\x80\x99il old man. And the fact that I\xe2\x80\x99ll spend my Saturday night making hummus supports this perspective.
Helps that I was never hip. https://t.co/icvT9qSW0C'

b'@bad71 @ScientistMel AVERAGE postal worker, sure - not a Dad who had 2 strokes & a heart attack so he couldn\xe2\x80\x99t work full time.\nThe year I made Clerks,\nMom told me Clerks cost double what my Dad made working for the P.O. that year. So if your internet search is right, we were just at the line in \xe2\x80\x9893.'

b'@allonmedia @JayMewes The filmmaker may not have been Rosario, but Miramax picked up and released Leslie Harris\xe2\x80\x99 JUST ANOTHER GIRL ON THE IRT a full 2 years before Clerks. The acquisition of her film gave me hope that maybe the same thing could happen with my flick one day. https://t.co/OK2LwsZZxA. https://t.co/gJWANfKLyv'

b'@nasdarovye @Lostsince2004 @mimisnowball @gwynn1984 @JayMewes So true.
It was the late 80\xe2\x80\x99s/early 90\xe2\x80\x99s, I had 0 credit rating, but the companies were still giving me cards.
I never used them either: just stacked them in my underwear drawer for years, until I made CLERKS.
Didn\xe2\x80\x99t wanna alarm my parents with the budget so I kept it all quiet.'

b'@genwhyprod @SnakeMCGaming @JayMewes I did ask for thoughts - 
but I didn\xe2\x80\x99t ask for you to Tweet incorrect information about my life.
However, I take it you just want me to read the misinformation you\xe2\x80\x99ve written about me  here and not correct it?
Got it. I\xe2\x80\x99m shutting up...'

b'@genwhyprod @SnakeMCGaming @JayMewes 1) I always had to work, to help with food and bills. 
2) I bought comics in lieu of clothes and wore the same outfit over & over.
3) My Dad never went to a hockey game. Ever. I only went to games when I got free tickets from my Mom\xe2\x80\x99s boss.
4) $200 is still a lot of money to me.'

b'@genwhyprod @SnakeMCGaming @JayMewes It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t MY movie, though: it belonged to the credit card company.\nMy family ate Gov Cheese. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t have some spare $20k sitting around, it was all on plastic.\nSo if Clerks didn\xe2\x80\x99t work, I was going to have to pay all that money off. Then I would\xe2\x80\x99ve been UNDER the poverty line.'

b'I guess this is what it comes down to.
I was happy and loved as a kid with a home, but dirt-poor - so I never felt that I was what I would define as \xe2\x80\x9cprivileged\xe2\x80\x9d.
And yet my meager circumstances could seem luxurious to someone with even less or fewer options than I had.
#WiserKev https://t.co/GevpP9ftjd'

b'@Vito_Kahn @JayMewes Never thought having parents who didn\xe2\x80\x99t toss me out of the house was a \xe2\x80\x9cprivilege.\xe2\x80\x9d But based on all the responses I\xe2\x80\x99ve read here, even *that* is a privileged perspective, since not everyone gets parents that are even as supportive. I always appreciated Mom & Dad; now even more.'

b'@mimisnowball @gwynn1984 @JayMewes To be fair, I got the credit-cards-for-a-movie idea from Robert Townsend, who financed his 1987 indie comedy HOLLYWOOD SHUFFLE the same way. I heard him talk about it on Howard Stern once and it stuck with me. Years later, I followed his example.\nhttps://t.co/AE1Mu2UWXi https://t.co/nOqi7yReIv'

b'@kryptokal @JamJeff19 @JayMewes Mr Thapar (owner of Quick Stop) emigrated from India in the 70\xe2\x80\x99s, and Mrs Thapar, their family & friends ran Quick Stop for years. I was hired at age 20 so the Thapars could work less and enjoy their 60\xe2\x80\x99s.\nSo as the first non-family member hired, I guess I *was* kinda privileged.'

b'@JamJeff19 @RTGatsby @JayMewes I got 14 credit cards without going into a bank ever.\nThey inundated us with applications in Junior College so I mailed a bunch in, saying I made $50k a year as manager of RST Video. They\xe2\x80\x99d call to confirm, I\xe2\x80\x99d answer RST\xe2\x80\x99s phone and say yes, then they\xe2\x80\x99d mail me a credit card.'

b'@JamJeff19 @JayMewes \xe2\x80\x9cDidn\xe2\x80\x99t have to work at 22 and still managed to fund a movie\xe2\x80\x9d?\nI was working at Quick Stop for 12 hours a day back then, before, during, and after the flick.\nThat\xe2\x80\x99s how I got the idea to make a movie about a guy who works all the time: because I was a guy who worked all the time.'

b'I always believed I was SELF-MADE, since my family hovered near the poverty line - so much so that I shot CLERKS on credit cards I had to exaggerate to qualify for.\nBut a friend said that, because I was living at home at age 22 with supportive parents, I was PRIVILEGED.\nThoughts? https://t.co/igChAnC8x9'

b'@BrianJCano @NJGov @NJTurnpike @GSParkway Corrected elsewhere in this thread. Meant @GSParkway Exit *for* the @NJTurnpike.\nBut you\xe2\x80\x99re right: I *have* been away too long.\nDamn Pandemic...'

b'@pop_silly @NJGov @NJTurnpike @GSParkway Agreed. But for me, \xe2\x80\x9cThe Shore\xe2\x80\x9d is a different designation than \xe2\x80\x9cCentral Jersey\xe2\x80\x9d - and actually *crosses* Central and South Jersey. For example, \xe2\x80\x9cThe Shore\xe2\x80\x9d includes Sandy Hook/Asbury Park (Central Jersey) as well as Seaside Heights (South Jersey).'
b'@spankinhenken @NJGov @NJTurnpike @GSParkway Ocean County is South Jersey to someone from Monmouth County.'

b'@PeteTheGreek13 @NJGov @NJTurnpike @GSParkway Yes! Correction:
For me, North Jersey starts at around Exit 129 (the @NJTurnpike entrance) on the @GSParkway.
And South Jersey starts at around Exit 82 on the @GSParkway. 
Everything in between (to me, mind you) is Central Jersey.
And in my world, it\xe2\x80\x99s Pork Roll, not Taylor Ham.'

b'Oh it\xe2\x80\x99s real alright. I was born & raised in Central Jersey. I can\xe2\x80\x99t speak for @NJGov, but for me? 
North Jersey starts at around Exit 129 on the @NJTurnpike.
And South Jersey starts at around Exit 82 on the @GSParkway. 
Everything in between (to me, mind you) is Central Jersey. https://t.co/rDyJlXXVHg'

b"Hey! The shark's dead! I think it's safe for us to go back in the water now! Thanks for being here for this 45th Anniversary #JawsAtHome Watch Along! The brand new 4k edition of JAWS is now available everywhere. And always remember kids: Amity, as you know, means friendship! https://t.co/pKF7WuGO38"

b'Brody and Hooper swimming back was a more terrifying notion to me than the shark jumping on the boat. I imagined that dead bloody shark would attract other predators these two would have to evade. I thought JAWS 2 was gonna be about their swim home. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/btTgVxlwm8'

b"They didn't have to wait until JAWS 4: with the shark coming back to kill Brody, it's clear that THIS time was personal too. That scene taught me basic screenwriting at a young age: set up the danger of the scuba tank early in the movie, then pay it off in the end. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/FX9KmGh7PZ"

b"Quint gets Jaws'd! One of the most terrifying moments in a movie for me as a kid. This kept me out of the water since I was 5 years old. The thing that always bugged me was, a few hours after the shark ate Quint, he just pooped him out. Waste of a great actor. #JawsAtHome"

b"If you're a JAWS fan, @thedailyjaws is a great follow! They've been waving the Amity flag and keeping JAWS alive for years now, always with fun, nostalgic Tweets. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/hSro4SIUVf"

b"JAWS inspired a game (this version was a re-release from 1986, I believe) that I would use to play JAWS with my Weebles (Weebles wobble but they don't fall down). Who else had/has this game? #JawsAtHome https://t.co/sh55xV6ocT"

b"As a kid, I hated this moment. But his action doesn't kill Brody or Hooper, it only gets himself killed. That's how I learned about poetic justice. The smashing of the radio is kind of Quint's Ahab moment, where killing the shark outweighs logic and self-preservation. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/QjbRpssPa8"

b"A moment of shark sympathy for the devil. The lead in JAWS is a giant fish, that's not there to terrorize Amity - it's just doing fish stuff. For that, he's stalked by three guys, shot, stabbed, harpooned, and ultimately atomized. Who's the real bad guy in this movie? #JawsAtHome https://t.co/twmy5Lle4E"

b"Something that captured my imagination every time I watched JAWS as a kid is how both Quint and Brody fire a rifle & handgun at the shark... And nothing happens. As a kid, I therefore believed sharks were bullet-proof. That's why I never brought a gun into the ocean. #JawsAtHome"

b'In my MOOSE JAWS script, they sing OH, CANADA to the tune of SHOW ME THE WAY TO GO HOME. An earlier draft of Moose Jaws included Jay & Silent Bob as our Quint, and they gave the Indianapolis speech. See me reading that earlier draft on WAKE & BAKE at https://t.co/c2Xw8c2aGm https://t.co/I5hAPNaGyy'

b"True this! And of course Carl Gottlieb deserves a little credit too. But at the end of the day, it's playwright Shaw who brings it all together in his head for both a drunken and a sober performance across 2 different shoot days. Magic. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/IcKy9MruKi"

b"Great question! No - never met Scheider, Dreyfuss, or Spielberg. Shaw was dead by the time I got into the business. The movie has been a massive influence on me but I've never met anyone involved except Joe Alves: https://t.co/HSbdqrPoXy  #JawsAtHome https://t.co/RliOOw9dbc"

b"The Indianapolis monologue by Robert Shaw is the single greatest monologue in movie history. There are no cutaways to flashback footage: we're just watching a man tell a story and it's THAT compelling! Great words, greater performance. What are other great monologues? #JawsAtHome"

b'This scene in CHASING AMY where they compare scares is a direct lift from JAWS, of course. But according to production designer Robert "RatFace" Holtzman, the light fixture hanging above them is actually FROM the movie Jaws. Can you tell or was RatFace fibbing? #JawsAtHome https://t.co/wx9leTCMJH'

b'"Well it proves one thing, Mister Hooper. Proves that you wealthy college boys don\'t have the education enough to admit when you\'re wrong." - Quint. This is as true today as it was in 1975. #JawsAtHome'

b"On the new 45th anniversary 4k JAWS, they've got cut scenes I've never saw before - and I've been watching this movie for DECADES. It also include the excellent documentary THE SHARK IS STILL WORKING. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/j5jgMCy7xj"

b"Are you kidding? So I'm now older than Robert Shaw was when he played Quint? He looks like a man to me, while I still look (and feel) like an overgrown teenager. In the 70's, gronwnups LOOKED like they were grown up. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/01l6FlGWWv"

b"One hour and twelve minutes into the movie, the ORCA finally heads out to sea with our three unlikely heroes thrown together. This is when the shoot turned into a nightmare, because shooting on the ocean is a nightmare, apparently. Mind you: they didn't have CGI yet. #JawsAtHome"
b'Am I allowed to vote? #JawsAtHome https://t.co/8nrNefzj7o'
b"HOLY SHIT! He's the spitting image in sight and sound! This made me so happy to see! Thanks for sharing! #JawsAtHome https://t.co/oQP4T3wg6E"

b"AGREED! And also one of the first looks at what the cast and crew called Bruce, the killer shark (named after Spielberg's lawyer). But this image has kept me out of the ocean since I was a child. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/s8n8BFygiE"

b"One of my favorite books of all time is THE JAWS LOG, written by JAWS screenwriter (and the Amity newspaper editor) CARL GOTTLIEB! It tells the twisted tale of what it took to make an American classic. Indispensable for filmmaking fans! It's an excellent page-turner! #JawsAtHome https://t.co/vKQ9wsfP95"

b"One of my next flicks is MOOSE JAWS. It's Jaws with a Moose, instead of a shark. Takes place at a Saskatchewan summer camp, Camp Antlers (seen on a shirt in @YogaHosers). Guy Lapointe (from @tuskthemovie) is our Quint-like character. (Hoping to do it with @Shudder.) #JawsAtHome"

b"The Shark Is Still Working, because these posters are on my daughter's bedroom wall in the year 2020. To the right is the domestic poster we all know and love. To the right, we have the Polish poster of JAWS. This is all the proof I need that I succeeded in parenting. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/CFDaDDDCvD"

b"I've often felt this as well. But I always assume Spielberg is a genius and knows what he's doing. But I always wanna reframe this shot, so Hooper's not just a floating head. Nobody needs Silent Bob correcting Spielberg. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/wfUTEFsTWZ"

b'There he is: the man who gave me a happy childhood... and ruined sharks for the last 45 years. Benchley later regretted giving sharks a bum rap and tried to turn their reputations around. Alas, the American (and world) public was once bitten, twice shy. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/ZPoyYq2DL8'

b'Which is more eye-catching: the billboard or the Mayor\'s amazing jacket? Quoting this scene allowed me to curse in front of my parents when I said "...swims up and bites you in the ass!" (I want the Mayor\'s jacket. Someone\'s gotta make it still. If anyone sees it, let me know.) https://t.co/RAZpnbo1D5'

b"After a test screening of the flick, Spielberg and company famously did a reshoot for this Ben Gardner scene in a backyard pool (I think it was editor Verna Fields' pool) to add the closeup of the dead man and get one more jump scare from the audience.  #JawsAtHome"
b'But Hooper lost the tooth. Mayor Vaughn wanted to see the tooth, the whole tooth, and nothing BUT the tooth. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/v7MffNdidq'

b"You have to remember, when JAWS came out in 1975, sharks weren't even a thing. Sure, they existed - but humanity didn't sweat sharks... until Benchley's book and Spielberg's film made sharks the most feared animal on the planet and a part of our primal nightmares #JawsAtHome"

b"WOW! That kid's got greatness in his veins! Shaw is brilliant as Quint, but check out his performance as Henry the Eighth in A MAN FOR ALL SEASONS for a total acting clinic! (P.S. - He was also a renowned playwright.) #JawsAtHome https://t.co/lJZ12KVp0h"

b"The moment Brody's kid Sean imitates his Dad is one of the finest moments in American Cinema. The killer shark story and special FX are put on hold for an incredibly human moment. I'll make movies my whole life and I'll never shoot a scene as simply perfect as this. #JawsAtHome"

b"JAWS was so big, that when JAWS 2 came out, they made trading cards. Trading cards for a movie about a killer shark. Let's suggest some inappropriate JAWS merchandise they might make today. Shredded Alex Kintner rafts? Shark-shaped vibrator?  #JawsAtHome https://t.co/bKj1qjezSd"

b'The voices of the shark fishermen who are trying to win Mrs. Kintner\'s bounty sound like the east coast voices of my childhood. When Hendricks mentions New Jersey as one of the local states where the fishermen came from, as a kid, I freaked out. "THEY KNOW WE EXIST!" #JawsAtHome'

b"The performances in JAWS are impeccable and the gold standard for any action/adventure movies. We know Jaws for the killer shark but we love Jaws for the three leads Scheider, Dreyfuss, and Shaw - even though they don't team up until over an hour into the movie. #JawsAtHome"
b'Artwork hanging in my house: a JAWS poster that shows off Amity for what she is: shark country. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/AmpGEZMP80'

b'In my 1st flick CLERKS, I reenacted JAWS in a bottle of salsa. It became the image that opened the trailer. JAWS has fed not only my imagination for 45 years, but also my work for 26 years. My not-so secret pipe dream since 1994 has been to make another JAWS sequel. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/Fnso9GIBIh'

b'JAWS hat from @UniStudios in Florida. I was gonna wear in when T.S. proposed to Brandy, after Jaws popped out of the water. The characters in my second flick MALLRATS were named for Jaws: T.S. Quint and Brodie Bruce. I later named a character in CHASING AMY Hooper. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/LjPAamQ2PA'

b"Even as a kid, I was frustrated nobody took the Chief seriously: I was 5 and even I knew the adults in Amity were mostly full of shit. When that little Kintner boy got swallowed - that was the end of going in the ocean for me. I've been in it maybe 5 times ever since. #JawsAtHome"

b'What Spielberg captures in this flick is life in a beach town. I remember seeing this and thinking "That\'s just like Highlands!" My New Jersey home town. "This could happen to us!" I\'d spend time on beaches, staring at the sea, trying to do a \'zoom\' shot with my eyes. #JawsAtHome'

b'MAYOR VAUGHN has been all over the internet lately as a stand-in for any government official in our world who wants to re-open the country after Covid. Haven\'t we all seen JAWS enough to know the folks in charge will always excuse everything as "a boating accident"? #JawsAtHome'

b"According to JAWS production designer Joe Alves, he was the first person hired on the flick. Producer David Brown worked with Joe (and Spielberg) on SUGARLAND EXPRESS, so after he read Benchley's galleys, he asked Joe to start sketching a shark, BEFORE even Spielberg. #JawsAtHome"

b"That shot of the hands! The human remains of the Christy the night swimmer! THAT was the only moment in JAWS that my parents made me close my eyes for. They didn't want me to see that, but THEY LET ME WATCH QUINT GET (SPOILERS!) EATEN ALIVE! #JawsAtHome"

b"JAWS was one of my first fandoms, and I've loved this flick for 45 years. When it finally played on network TV 4 or 5 years later, I recorded the movie on a tape recorder, so I could listen to it over and over. Jaws Fans could buy merchandise like this pendant. #JawsAtHome https://t.co/9a7WUoIHKE"

b"I love Chris Nolan's take on BATMAN, but the Nolan version of #TheBatmobile is my least favorite of the fleet. I respect it and I understand the vision of a realistic Batmobile - but for me, my favorite Batmobiles were impractical improbabilities. Like Batman himself. #DCTuesdays"

b'My friend @RalphGarman loved @therealadamwest so much, he was responsible for getting Adam his star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame - a ceremony Adam was still alive to enjoy. Ralph took his childhood devotion to the Bat and brought it into the real world. #TheBatmobile #DCTuesdays https://t.co/23uJz959v5'

b'When I was writing the script for the unmade SUPERMAN LIVES back in 1997, I got to visit the set of BATMAN AND ROBIN. I saw them shoot the Mr. Freeze chase through a tunnel. It was also the day they first presented #TheBatmobile to Joel Schumacher, so I saw that too. #DCTuesdays'
b'Got a Batman bank from the 1989 Batman Cereal, but I never got a life size version of #TheBatmobile. #DCTuesdays https://t.co/cmSQH2q0Q0'

b"I know I'll get crucified for playing favorites, but the ANTON FURST Batmobile is my favorite version of #TheBatmobile. It may not have been incredibly functional for urban warfare, but it is dark joy on wheels to me. RIP Anton. Thanks for your vision (of Gotham too). #DCTuesdays"

b"I remember @MTV had a contest in 1989 to win ANTON FURST'S version of #TheBatmobile. I called incessantly that day, desperate to claim the car as my own. Alas, I was not the winner. I've heard Jeff Dunham has one but I've never been that wealthy. #DCTuesdays"

b"TIM BURTON'S 1989 BATMAN! The Bat-craze of '89 was BEYOND huge. The giant Bat symbol billboard in Times Square. People with the symbol shaved into their heads. Everyone wearing the symbol on t-shirts. This was back before comic book culture was the norm. #DCTuesdays #TheBatmobile"

b'So many amazing directors have taken #TheBatmobile to the screen, and they got the least worthy director to talk about it. But all love and respect to Burton, Shumacher, Nolan, Snyder, and now Reeves. You are the the dreamers of our dreams, my betters. Many thanks! #DCTuesdays'

b"My first Batmobile was the George Barris Batmobile from the BATMAN TV show starring ADAM WEST and BURT WARD. The car that Barris converted captured this kid's imagination. The red/orange striping on the black represents a happy childhood. #TheBatmobile #DCTuesdays"

b'The first time I saw a Batman anything it was Batman #251. I found the comic book at a barber shop, where I got my first haircut, age 4. I was scared because the barber chair was so huge. But the Batman book gave me enough courage to sit through the cut. #DCTuesdays #TheBatmobile'
b"And we're off! Watch #TheBatmobile while I Tweet along on #DCTuesdays! It's happening here: https://t.co/2Lx2weVMCp"
b'At 5pst/8est! I answer the Bat Signal to live tweet #TheBatmobile screening on #DCTuesdays!\nWatch along with me here: https://t.co/NFHoX394Zg https://t.co/22ptPS8AMX'

b'TONIGHT! I\xe2\x80\x99m coming back for round 2 of #DCTuesdays! Join me for an atomic battery to power and turbines to speed Live Tweeting of #TheBatmobile! At 5pm PT/ 8pm ET!\nWatch along with me here: https://t.co/NFHoX394Zg https://t.co/lIKiZZRctm'
b'Quarantine cleaning the office and found this reminder that I almost got to direct a \xe2\x81\xa6@Degrassi\xe2\x81\xa9 feature film back in the day. https://t.co/0sDLs5y2nh'

b'On WEDNESDAY, watch @JayMewes and I play each other in the @InterabangEnt game MALL BRAWL! It\xe2\x80\x99ll be on my @YouTube & @Facebook & Jay\xe2\x80\x99s @Twitch! And TODAY at https://t.co/c2Xw8c2aGm you can hear a new PLUS ONE w/ @JenSchwalbach, or watch me read MOOSE JAWS all week on WAKE & BAKE! https://t.co/YkmEFTgD7z'

b'Why all the https://t.co/c2Xw8c2aGm hostility? Free funny still exists: SModcast, Babble-On, & Fat Man Beyond are still free as fuck as podcasts. @JayMewes and I stream shows free every week. Our back catalogue hasn\xe2\x80\x99t been free for the last 2 years (it was on @Stitcher Premium). https://t.co/eiVvVHMYi7'
b'The sequel to THOR: RAGNAROK looks amazing! The Grandmaster learned some serious moves from watching the Hulk and Thor fight on Sakaar! Contest of Champions indeed! https://t.co/66mEGCmtAh'

b'Wanna be a hero? The @heroinitiative is auctioning off a virtual meet-&-greet with the guy who made @YogaHosers for their cheery charity! (For more info, click the link below!) https://t.co/kxbiXUBbur'

b'19 years ago this August. Thanks to everyone who ever asked \xe2\x80\x9cWhen are you gonna make another #JayAndSilentBob movie?\xe2\x80\x9d Especially \xe2\x81\xa6@JayMewes\xe2\x81\xa9. The REBOOT is now available on \xe2\x81\xa6@PrimeVideo\xe2\x81\xa9. https://t.co/I5uOzvpfNk'

b'Thanks to @russburlingame and @ComicBook for allowing me four hours to Tweet on my favorite subject in the world: Kevin Smith and his stupid Kevin Smith movies. Thanks to everyone who followed along and thanks to @JordanMonsanto for making REBOOT a reality! #QuarantineWatchParty https://t.co/LbnVnAUDlo'

b"JAY & SILENT BOB REBOOT was the best time I ever had making a movie. Some of that had to do with the fact that I was supposed to be dead, but it was largely due to my man @JayMewes - the guy without whom none of this ever would've happened. Love you Jay! #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"EVERY NIGHT of the REBOOT Roadshow Tour, when the Quick Stop boys from STRIKE BACK showed up, the audience went nuts. They might have been their favorite returning characters. I wish I could've kept them in the main story but glad they owned the credits. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"Closing song SHECKY DON'T LIKE IT was written and performed by @StephenGris, after I talked about wanting to hear the song on an episode of SMODCAST. Gris put a tiny piece of the song on the internet and I loved it. So I asked him to finish it for REBOOT. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"The @TheRealStanLee scene in the credits comes courtesy of @IMDb. Look how genuinely happy Stan was. He's cracking himself up. Since he was meant to be with us when we made the flick, I wanted to end with this homage to him. Always brought down the house. #QuarantineWatchParty"
b"It's @_mcchris on the closing credits track! Chris also has the SMODCAST theme in the movie as well. He did songs for JAY & SILENT BOB'S SUPER GROOVY CARTOON MOVIE too. #QuarantineWatchParty"
b'He did! @erictcarrasco warmed her up first, so it made it easy to ask. You can see Eric driving the Ride-Me-Now car when Milly drugs Jay & Silent Bob. #QuarantineWatchParty https://t.co/uIAXgQgZDz'

b"I used the @PearlJam classic DAUGHTER as a temp track during editing, never imagining we'd score the song for the flick. You have no idea how clever I felt when I thought of using this track! Perfect way to end a trip back to the 90's, where it all began. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'ALICE WEN actually spoke in Mandarin under her breath as the podcast recording SHAN YU. She crushed the thankless role of the character least likely to exist in real life. As such, her "straight man" allowed others to be more showy. So thank you, Alice! #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"IRON BOB!  I owe @MarvelStudios money First wrote him into MALLRATS 2: DIE HARD IN A MALL. Then, when that flick didn't happen, I stole the entire third act for REBOOT. But in the old RATS 2, it wasn't Russian terrorists, it was CANADIAN terrorists. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"The Kevin Smith character in REBOOT was a poor replacement for @TheRealStanLee. Stan was meant to be Shan Yu's target at Chronic Con. But after Stan passed, I rewrote the part for a lesser pop culture figure who I knew was gonna be on set every day anyway. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'One of the first folks to sign on was @MelissaBenoist. I asked her about it when I was on my second @TheCWSupergirl episode and she said "One summer, my sister and I watched STRIKE BACK every day for a week." At Melissa\'s wedding, her sister confirmed this. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"I know it's corny as fuck, but I love when we push in on Milly for Jay's return. It's akin to the push in on Gertie in JERSEY GIRL. In fact if you look closely, REBOOT is just JERSEY GIRL with more curses. It's an oddly authentic movie about being a Dad. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"In the CHASING AMY scene in REBOOT, I got to write @BenAffleck as myself again. Holden McNeil is the closest character to me I've ever created. So when we got Ben at the last minute, I was able to say all the stuff *I* wanted to through Holden. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"The highlight of the movie - the CHASING AMY reunion scene with @JoeyLaurenAdams and @BenAffleck - exists because @KevinMcCarthyTV asked Ben a question at a junket. This scene didn't exist until the last week of production. Always stay open and nimble, kids! #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'CHRONIC CON was the entire last week of the shoot. It was originally meant to be @Comic_Con with real IP, but that was going to be cost prohibitive. That\'s when I realized "I own Jay & Silent Bob. So let\'s make it a Jay & Bob Con!" Way easier to clear. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'CHRIS HEMSWORTH signed on before even Matt or Ben. He\'d said in an article that he heard me on a podcast. I was like "Thor knows my name?!?" So when we were casting, we reached out to him. After we shot him, I was one of his guests at the ENDGAME premiere. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'My favorite moment in REBOOT is when Milly wakes up and sees the Hollywood sign. This movie may be goofy as fuck but that is EXACTLY how I\'ve felt every day of my life for the last 26 years. "Holy shit. We made it." We did. Makes me roll a tear every time. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"A version of this REBOOT scene (stealing dialogue from GLENGARRY, which we had to get permission to do) appeared in a draft of MOOSE JAWS. This week, I'm reading some cut scenes from the MOOSE JAWS script on WAKE & BAKE, my show at https://t.co/c2Xw8c2aGm #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'This is the Glengary Klan Ross scene, starring Le Champion @IAmJericho. My kid and my wife implored me to take this scene out, as it might offend audiences. I said "We end the scene spraying shit on racists. Who\'s gonna admit to being offended by that?" #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"This was one of the scariest REBOOT scenes for me to watch every night, as I was terrified that this is where we'd lose the audience. Shit gets tender and emotional: Harley cries, JAY cries. But every night, the kid & Jay were able to stick the landing. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"Listen closely and you'll hear the great STEPHEN ROOT doing all sorts of VoiceOver in REBOOT (like the Drive Thru voice and all the CockMandoes at Chronic Con). Stephen was also in JERSEY GIRL and RED STATE. He's now Cringer in our @MastersOfficial show. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"I was so impressed with @aparnabrielle, I built my next flick around her: Aparna will play Brodie Bruce's daughter Banner Bruce in the movie I hope to shoot next - TWILIGHT OF THE MALLRATS. @DohertyShannen already read the script and LOVED! Lee reading now! #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'The scene @methodman & @therealredman shot on REBOOT was one of the easiest we shot. I\'d never worked with either of them before so I didn\'t know they were first-take FIRE! This is all taken from the 1st take. I stole "That shit\'s unseemly" from THE WIRE #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"Silent Bob is out Silent Bob'ed by the amazing @TreshelleEdmond! I wanted to show that - even though she didn't know Jay her whole life - Milly was still his kid on a genetic level. So Milly, too, is drawn to a hetero life mate who doesn't do much talking. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"ROSARIO DAWSON was shooting @Zombieland in Atlanta when we were shooting REBOOT in #NOLA. So she snuck away for a day to shoot her cameo. Meant the world then, still does now. She's one of my favorite people on the planet. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"This is where the movie takes off for me: when Jay meets Milly. My two children - my daughter Harley and my surrogate son @JayMewes - play movie relatives. I know I'm gonna get crucified for this, but... I love this movie because of their performances in it. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"The return of @ShannonElizab! When I put up a pic of @JayMewes and Shannon on @instagram, folks were so crazy happy to see these characters together again - as if their's was an epic romance. But in real life, Shannon fights rhino poachers in Africa. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"The structure of REBOOT closely follows STRIKE BACK. If you're watching them back-to-back, you can really see it. And see the guy that's double-fisting coffee outside of Mooby's? That's @DavidHMandel. He did the same thing in STRIKE BACK outside the bus. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"I watched REBOOT with the audience every night of the Reboot Roadshow Tour. And I always shot the audience's reaction to seeing @JenSchwalbach so I could text it to her and she could hear the applause. She pwns my dick. #QuarantineWatchParty"
b'Matt Damon!  #QuarantineWatchParty https://t.co/SdiKvVZDak'

b'My BABBLE brother @RalphGarman saved the third act of @YogaHosers and he saved the Ted Underhill scene. Listen to him every day at https://t.co/osI93icOKc (Speaking of which, listen to me daily at https://t.co/c2Xw8c2aGm). #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'This is the crowd from night 2 of the tour (in Chicago) but it\xe2\x80\x99s representative of what it was like every night on the Reboot Roadshow! Sometimes I think I did die from the heart attack, because the Tour was HEAVEN! #QuarantineWatchParty https://t.co/tUPgIpFd2G'

b"This is the post-heart attack movie, so I was hoping folks would excuse me for this incredibly self-referential masturbatory love-fest. I was feeling old because I'd almost died - so I pulled my toys out of attic and played like I did when I was a kid. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"JASON LEE (who hadn't acted in 4 yrs) returned as Brodie (giving @captainmarvel a shout-out in return)! I recently finished the first draft of TWILIGHT OF THE MALLRATS which we're hoping to shoot in this very same mall in New Orleans (where we shot REBOOT). #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"Hey #QuarantineWatchParty! We didn't release REBOOT in the standard fashion because nobody would've given a fuck and we would've lost money. So instead, we kept our budget low and toured the flick like we tour our podcasts. In the process, this happened: https://t.co/05yHd9hPpW"

b'JUSTIN LONG is playing his character Brandon St. Randy from ZACK & MIRI MAKE A PORNO. But I never set it up properly because Z&M was a Weinstein Co. flick - and I wanted REBOOT to be Weinstein-free. So I never name the character to avoid having to ask them. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"Opening w/ @Dastmalchian and @donnellrawlings was originally written for the unmade CLERKS 3. The third act of REBOOT was taken from the unmade MALLRATS 2 script. REBOOT's success then paved the way for a new CLERKS 3 & RATS 2. So I wrote different scripts. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'A minute before the COVID came, I was finishing the REBOOT ROADSHOW tour. We sold 65 thousand tickets and hit 67 cities in 3 countries. I got to watch REBOOT with the audiences every night. It was like going to a church where I was both the priest AND Jesus. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"HEY KIDS! @JayMewes and I are ready to go with Part 2 of our #JayAndSilentBob Double Feature #QuarantineWatchParty, brought to you by @russburlingame & the good folks at @ComicBook! Next up is 2019's JAY & SILENT BOB REBOOT (it's on @PrimeVideo)! And the REBOOT begins RIGHT NOW!"

b'I honestly never imagined we\'d ever make a sequel to J&SBSB. But @JayMewes would always ask me when we were gonna do it again. I\'d say "There\'s no audience." After selling out shows around the world with our GET OLD podcast, I realized I might be wrong... #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"This movie would not exist without the great Scott Mosier - the guy who made sure all my dopey ideas turned into movies. I met him at @vfs - and I can't think of a better advertisement for their school. They gave me an education... and they gave me Scott. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"Look at how happy I am in this movie. That's not acting. This was the last good time. Next, we'd make JERSEY GIRL - and we know how that went. But here I am, a new husband/dad starring in a movie with my best friend, dancing w/ movie stars. Time of my life! #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"I was a big PURPLE RAIN fan, but as much as I dug Prince, I LOVED Morris Day's character. And the relationship between him and Jerome was one of the models for Jay & Silent Bob. So it made sense to close the flick with them. Jerome taught me to dance! #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'JAY & SILENT BOB STRIKE BACK was me saying "I can\'t believe I got to make four movies! Let\'s talk about all of them in the fifth one!" REBOOT is a much more dignified self-love fest. This flick was celebrating a career that had only been around six years. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'Two of my favorite exchanges in the movie: 1) "Stop stealing monkeys." "Fuck you." "Fair enough." 2) "Wait for me." "What, HERE?" Also: shoutout to TANGO the orangutan, who now lives in a great ape rescue in Florida. Nowadays, she\'d be a CG effect. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"I loved JIM VENABLES' score so much, I brought him back for REBOOT as well. We found Jim by way of his score for THE POWERPUFF GIRLS. This marked the first time Jim got to work with a full orchestra - and his grandma who raised him got to see it happen. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"The BLUNTMOBILE is still on display at @The_SecretStash in Red Bank, NJ. So is the Buddy Christ. It's essentially a me-seum that showcases all my flicks (and sells comics). If the world ever gets out of lockdown, it makes a nice road trip! So come see us! #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'This is my favorite part of JAY & SILENT BOB STRIKE BACK: the third act where everything goes nuts. I stole these endings from the comedies of my youth. In ANIMAL HOUSE and CADDYSHACK, shit always goes nuts in the third act. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"The reason I did the HEY, KIDS! IT'S MARK HAMILL card when @HamillHimself first appears in the flick is because he was unrecognizable in the hair and makeup we put on him, and I wanted EVERYBODY to know we scored the Son of Skywalker. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'Yes - I wrote a scene where I got to lightsaber battle w/ @HamillHimself! My parents were on set that day. Mark asked my Mom "It must blow your mind, seeing your son do all this." My Mom said "He used to play with your action figure, now he plays with you." #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"CHRIS ROCK was a big CHASING AMY fan. He said he did STRIKE BACK because he wanted me to write him the lead in the next Chasing Amy I made. But luckily, Chris didn't wait for me: he made HIS Chasing Amy when he directed TOP 5 (w/ Rosario as his female lead). #QuarantineWatchParty"
b'When @Paul_Dini says "You guys look pretty bad-ass" to me and @JayMewes? That\'s Jay\'s favorite moment in JAY & SILENT BOB STRIKE BACK. It still makes him laugh. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"BLUNTMAN AND CHRONIC were created for CHASING AMY as a self-critical commentary about Jay & Silent Bob's slapstick-y depiction in MALLRATS as opposed to their edgy reality in CLERKS. Oddly enough, they became the plot points of two different (kinda) movies. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"Just stop following me, my friend. We're doing a JAY AND SILENT BOB #QuarantineWatchParty and there's like another 2 hours of this lame randomness coming your way. I can't stop now: people are counting on me. So you gotta let me go, Rose. Stay on the board. I'll sink away... https://t.co/OxtRTOM0AH"

b"JASON BIGGS and JAMES VAN DER BEEK came back as themselves in REBOOT 18 years later and their chemistry was still electric. I assumed they were old friends, but they said they hadn't seen each other since STRIKE BACK. They're just great actors. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'Since I got the idea for a Jay & Silent Bob in Hollywood movie on the set of SCREAM 3 after the great Wes Craven let me cameo in his flick, I returned the favor (we also shared a birthday). And @DohertyShannen will return with us in TWILIGHT OF THE MALLRATS! #QuarantineWatchParty'
b"Very much so. When I wrote REBOOT, I didn't think I'd get Ben & Matt again. So I became the famous idiot instead. #QuarantineWatchParty https://t.co/bjlHvLLXBg"

b'BEN & MATT! The boys came up with "LION FACE! LEMON FACE!" The rest of the movie-bashing dialogue is me. We brought back Scott Winters from the original Good Will Hunting scene to surprise the boys. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'The great @bader_diedrich (beloved in BATMAN: THE BRAVE & THE BOLD) ad-libbed the greatest line in the movie: "Oh, what a lovely tea party." He was also one of the first folks to sign up for the sequel. Now he\'s an amazing King Randor in @MastersOfficial! #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"TRACY MORGAN! I'm a lifelong @nbcsnl fan, and I loved Tracy's brand of whimsy. He came up with his character's name, Pumpkin Escobar. His Silent Bob (Scott) was our assistant props man. A few flicks later, I'd reunite with Tracy on the beleaguered COP OUT. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"This flick & REBOOT are goofy as fuck but I always well-up with tears when I watch them for one simple reason: the boys want to go to Hollywood, just like I did when I was a kid. This movie and the sequel are a child's wish come true, with dirty words in it. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"It was wishful thinking. But we got in trouble with GLAAD with this flick and I never understood that: STRIKE BACK is so pro-gay, one of the titular characters admits he'd blow the other. I've always included gay-friendly content for my brother in my movies. #QuarantineWatchParty https://t.co/Q22O9MB1eO"

b"Oh, I love Kevin Smith movies. It's like they're made just for me. This shit still makes me giggle, 19 years after the fact. All the movies operate as secret scrap books of my life. #QuarantineWatchParty https://t.co/GhXQtqyumy"

b'I was a big BREAKFAST CLUB fan, so getting JUDD NELSON was a huge coup for me. I had seen him once in real life, at a screening of the @AdamRifkin movie THE DARK BACKWARD, but when he got to set, I asked every John Hughes question I had ever wanted to know. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"So before we make STRIKE BACK, Bob Weinstein makes me and Scott Mosier watch ROAD TRIP with him, insisting that Todd Phillips was a genius and I should be more like him. At the time, I was insulted. After I saw JOKER, I wish I'd taken Bob more seriously. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'Bob Weinstein ran DIMENSION, the folks that made STRIKE BACK. After DOGMA, Bob asked if @JayMewes and I wanted to cameo in SCREAM 3. We shot our cameo at the CBS Radford lot. Afterwards, I say to Jay "Wouldn\'t it be fun to do a whole movie here?" So we did.\n#QuarantineWatchParty'

b'WILL FERRELL had done SUPERSTAR and not much else at this point but me and Jason Lee loved his "Be a buddy and get off the shed" sketch on SNL so we went after him. Originally, Bob Weinstein wanted Tom Green - but Tom was too pricey after ROAD TRIP. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'I loved working with @elizadushku. She was always so funny and real. I handed her a rewrite where her character got to say "Bring it on," and she said "I saw what you did there, Smittles." I wanted to cast her in JERSEY GIRL before Ben suggested JLo. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'YEARS before IRON MAN or THE AVENGERS, I gave my costumer the Black Widow statute and said "The girl gang looks like this, please." I remember being asked by a journalist during the junket "It\'s a little comic book-y, no?" I was so proud to say "Sure is!" #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"Silent Bob running around Provasik stolen from Bluto in ANIMAL HOUSE. Provasik stolen from the movie THE FUGITIVE. I used to like to sneak in names from other movies/TV shows to see if they cleared. Trish's MALLRATS book published by Pendant (from Seinfeld). #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'I met with Matthew McConaughey for this flick. Again: I was coming off DOGMA (and CHASING AMY), so folks thought "He\'s gonna make another smart, critical darling." Matthew had just done a cameo in SEX & THE CITY around then. I said "You\'re too good for us." #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'HEIDI KLUM was originally cast as one of the girl gang (I think I still have the chair back with her name on it and her audition tape). Then she dropped out and we landed ALI LARTER instead. I met with lots of famous folks for this flick. It so was weird. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"Miss @ShannonElizab was coming off of the AMERICAN PIE flicks and SCARY MOVIE when we scored her for STRIKE BACK. Without her, we couldn't have made REBOOT 18 years later. This unlikely romance provided the biggest plot point in REBOOT. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'The only constants on this flick were me and @JayMewes. The rest of the cast changed every day, with some new talented, famous fuckers joining us to make my dopey dreams come true. We were coming off of DOGMA, so folks still thought I  had a big future. HA! #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"See the actress in the driver seat? I totally slept with her. I'm still sleeping with her. To be fair, I was sleeping with @JenSchwalbach long before I cast her as Missy. My kid is also in the movie as Baby Silent Bob. Then in REBOOT, Harley got an upgrade. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"MOOBY'S! This was the second appearance of our fake eatery in the View Askewniverse, after its DOGMA debut. Recently, @SavedByTheMax did a Mooby's Pop-Up in L.A. and we raised 10k for charity. Our IRL Mooby's restaurant opens this summer (with Cow Tippers)! #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'The next movie I did after STRIKE BACK was JERSEY GIRL. I sent George Carlin the script and asked him to play Ben\'s Dad in the movie. When I asked him if he liked the script, he said "Well there\'s a little girl in the story, but I sure don\'t strangle her." #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'I drove back to base camp with GEORGE CARLIN after he did the trucker-blower cameo. While thanking him for making the time for us, he said "Just write me my dream role: I wanna play a clergy man who strangles six children." #QuarantineWatchParty'

b'CARRIE FISHER agreed to be in STRIKE BACK for no money. She just wanted us to buy a pair of antique beaver chairs. When I met her on set, I asked "Why the chairs?" She said "I thought beaver was ironic currency to be in your movie." Loved her so much. #QuarantineWatchParty'

b"JAY AND SILENT BOB STRIKE BACK was a response to DOGMA, where we'd received 300k pieces of hate mail and 3 legit death threats. After a year of controversy, I wanted to make a movie that wouldn't offend. But this movie has an obscenely high FUCK count. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"Busy @BenAffleck came to our STRIKE BACK set from I think PEARL HARBOR and then was heading to SUM OF ALL FEARS after us. We had him around July 4th, 2001, and that weekend, he invited me to a BBQ at his house. It's been my house for the last 18 yrs now. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b"I love Jason Lee. He came back as Brodie for #Jayandsilentbobreboot and he'll return again in TWILIGHT OF THE MALLRATS. In Strike Back, we shot him as bearded Banky in L.A. Then when we went back to Jersey for @The_SecretStash scene, he shaved for Brodie. #QuarantineWatchParty"

b'Jesus, @JayMewes and I look youn. And heavy. Bob Weinstein called after seeing one day of dailies and said "Silent Bob\'s supposed to be the fat one. Get Jay a trainer." I said "Are you nuts? He\'s trying to kick heroin, man. That\'s therapeutic booze bloat." #QuarantineWatchParty'
b"Hey, Kids! It's time for the JAY AND SILENT BOB #QuarantineWatchParty Double Feature! Thanks to @ComicBook for gathering us together! Let us now STRIKE BACK! https://t.co/jBZCTIgRVl"
b'Oh my God... I\xe2\x80\x99m Kevin Hart?!? Holy shit, I\xe2\x80\x99M RICH!!! https://t.co/0UqXDx7odA'

b'That was an emotional journey into the legacy of Superman! Thanks for watching #LookUpInTheSky, and thanks to @WBHomeEnt for #DCTuesdays! Remember kids: always stand for Truth & Justice like Superman! (Except for the part where you lie to everybody you know about being Superman.)'

b"We'll be due for a new cinematic incarnation of the Man of Steel in a few years, but for now? Superman returns to @TheCW later this year in a new show. And @MelissaBenoist continues to CRUSH it weekly on @TheCWSupergirl! #LookUpInTheSky is almost over kids!"
b"Wow. I forgot Cyclops was in a Superman movie. This makes me wanna rewatch SUPERMAN RETURNS. Haven't seen it since release. #LookUpInTheSky"

b"As we enter the @BrandonJRouth era of #LookUpInTheSky, I'm happy to report Brandon IS the embodiment of Superman: he's a sweet, funny, noble dude (who I got to work with in ZACK & MIRI MAKE A PORNO). It was awesome that he got to put on the suit again in CRISIS. #LookUpInTheSky"
b'JON PETERS pops up in #LookUpInTheSky! I met that guy once... https://t.co/pNw1GRlb5Y'
b"Dammit... I forgot we'd have to deal with the death of Chris Reeve in #LookUpInTheSky. Crying now..."

b'Look at that. Without a word, he communicates everything heartbreaking about this strange visitor from another planet - the last Son of Krypton. He literally played two different characters. I hope they paid him twice. #LookUpInTheSky https://t.co/EBkyUpnHze'

b"Without SMALLVILLE, you wouldn't have @TheCW versions of @DCComics we have now. Directing @CW_TheFlash  & @TheCWSupergirl up in Canada, half the crew also worked on SMALLVILLE back in the day. They used SFX tricks learned on that show to produce the current shows. #LookUpInTheSky"

b"SUPERMAN: THE ANIMATED SERIES! This amazing cartoon features the absolute best incarnation of BRAINIAC. I saw every ep with @JayMewes but Jay was always a bigger SMALLVILLE fan. The show creators once sent me a fax asking me to direct an episode. Wish I'd done it. #LookUpInTheSky"

b'CHRISTOPHER REEVE will forever be Superman to me. You could relate to him either as Clark or Kal. He took a Christ-like approach to playing the Man of Steel. Look for the video of him talking about working with Marlon Brando. Dude had tons of integrity. #LookUpInTheSky'

b"GENE HACKMAN'S Lex Luthor the guy I got to play on the playground whenever we played Superman. He made Luthor the villain you love to hate. Didn't even care he wasn't bald ('til he was). Dude literally wanted to sink California into the sea for a real estate scam. #LookUpInTheSky"

b"Donner's SUPERMAN: THE MOVIE is more influential than most folks realize. In the 7 episodes of @TheCWSupergirl and @CW_TheFlash I've been lucky enough to direct, this movie is still invoked and used as a model by the writers and producers. It's the Gold Standard. #LookUpInTheSky"

b"After Carrie Fisher, MARGOT KIDDER was every boy's (and many girls') childhood crush. Her portrayal of gutsy newshound Lois Lane inspired many of us to seek out the same type of woman to marry. So when I met my wife @JenSchwalbach, she was a writer at @USATODAY. #LookUpInTheSky"

b"I love director Richard Donner. He's a great storyteller and he always seemed so real. I met with him last year to discuss doing a series about how he made SUPERMAN: THE MOVIE. I knew I was a longshot to get the job so I went just to hear Donner tell stories. #LookUpInTheSky"

b'The Salkinds secured the movie rights to make a Superman movie and brought it to @wbpictures. Since @DCComics is owned by WB now, this would never happen today. The Salkinds had all the control over the casting, the director, the budget. Unthinkable now. #LookUpInTheSky'

b"While we watch #LookUpInTheSky and examine Superman's long legacy, let's wish the most recent Man of Steel, HENRY CAVILL, a very Happy Birthday! We're glad your parents stuck you in that rocket and sent you to us! You honored the cape, sir!"

b"When the BATMAN tv show exploded on TV, creating a campy take on comic books, Superman was on Broadway in his own musical. Comic book culture took center stage decades before we think it did, but it didn't stick like it has in the last 20 years. #LookUpInTheSky"

b"I have never seen the SuperPup footage before! Holy crap, it looks like Peter Jackson's MEET THE FEEBLES. The heartbreaking loss of George Reeves ended the TV show, but had no effect on the comics. During that time, Mort Weisinger gave us Kandor and Bizarro. #LookUpInTheSky"

b'Watching @HamillHimself get animated about ADVENTURES OF SUPERMAN is a reminder that he may be our Luke Skywalker forever, but he was a fan first. Was also awesome seeing @TheRealStanLee pop in and give Superman love. Stan was always clear: No Superman, No Marvel. #LookUpInTheSky'

b"I watched every episode of ADVENTURES OF SUPERMAN in reruns when I was a kid, but I liked Batman more. Superman didn't have many colorful villains in the show: he fought dudes in suits. Batman fought monsters in colorful costumes, Supes fought 50's gangsters. #LookUpInTheSky"
b"George Reeves played Superman. @BenAffleck played George Reeves. Then he played Batman. That's some Lincoln/Kennedy kinda stuff. #LookUpintheSky"

b'"Faster than a speeding bullet! More powerful than a locomotive! Able to leap tall buildings in a single bound! #LookUpintheSky! It\'s a bird! It\'s a plane! It\'s SUPERMAN!" -Opening Narration from The Adventures of Superman. Those exciting words still capture my imagination today.'

b'The black and white Superman show with Noell Neil as Lois Lane and George Reeves as Superman. My Mom had a train set with little white figures for townsfolk that we set up at Christmas. I took the white figure, put red PlayDoh on it, and made him stop the train. #LookUpintheSky'

b"The Max Fleischer Superman Cartoons still hold up today! Without them, we wouldn't have the Batman: The Animated Series we got. The creative team from Gotham borrow from the look and feel of Fleischer's Supes. #LookUpintheSky"

b"Superman fought the Klan on radio long before the recent comic book! The ultimate American immigrant represented  every kid. Could you imagine being new to this country, scared and discovering Superman wasn't all that different from you? No wonder they loved him! #LookUpintheSky"

b"Superman was born on the comics page, but quickly moved to radio. Could a superhero radio show work today - or are audiences too used to spectacular visuals? I'd be ALL for doing a scripted Superman radio show/podcast. #LookUpintheSky"

b'Every generation gets the Superhero it needs. Superman was born amidst the Depression. What superhero will come from this Quaratine (one that orders lots of take out food and masturbates daily, no doubt)? #LookUpintheSky'

b'Jerry Siegal and Joe Shuster - one was American, one was Canadian. They created Superman in Cleveland, but the city of Metropolis is based on Toronto. The first Superhero was North American, born of two countries. And the character was an immigrant from space.  #LookUpintheSky'

b"And we're off! #LookUpintheSky! Right now, the film is covering Siegal and Shuster - the two boys who connected at age 16 and dreamed of making comic books! Superman was born amidst the environment of the Depression. Hope from hopelessness."
